026package com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators;
027
028import java.util.logging.Logger;
029
030import com.ibm.streams.operator.AbstractOperator;
031import com.ibm.streams.operator.OperatorContext;
032import com.ibm.streams.operator.logging.LogLevel;
033import com.ibm.streams.operator.logging.LoggerNames;
034import com.ibm.streams.operator.logging.TraceLevel;
035
036/**
037 * Operator that solely demonstrates source code use
038 * of {@code java.util.logging.Logger} to send messages
039 * to the SPL log and trace facilities.
040 *
041 * @see LogLevel
042 * @see TraceLevel
043 * @see LoggerNames
044 * @see AbstractOperator#setLoggerAspects(String, String...)
045 */
046public class LoggerUseExample extends AbstractOperator {
047    
048    private static final String CLASS_NAME = LoggerUseExample.class.getName();
049        
050    /**
051     * Create a {@code Logger} specific to this class that will write
052     * to the SPL trace facility as a child of the root {@code Logger}.
053     */
054    private final Logger trace = Logger.getLogger(CLASS_NAME);
055    
056    /**
057     * Create a {@code Logger} specific to this class that will write
058     * to the SPL log facility as a child of the {@link LoggerNames#LOG_FACILITY}
059     * {@code Logger}.
060     * The {@code Logger} uses a resource bundle.
061     */
062    private final Logger log =
063        Logger.getLogger(LoggerNames.LOG_FACILITY + "." + CLASS_NAME,
064                "com.ibm.streams.operator.samples.operators.messages");
065    
066    /**
067     * Sample uses of log and trace.
068     */
069    @Override
070    public void initialize(OperatorContext context) throws Exception {
071        super.initialize(context);
072        
073        // Note setLoggerAspects() must be called after super.initialize(context)
074        // as it requires the context.
075        
076        // Associate the aspects exampleTrace and testTrace with trace
077        // messages from the SPL trace logger
078        setLoggerAspects(trace.getName(), "exampleTrace", "testTrace");
079        
080        // Associate the aspect exampleLog with messages from the SPL log logger.
081        setLoggerAspects(log.getName(), "exampleLog");
082        
083        // Example use of trace to dump all parameters. The level uses
084        // the Java Operator API specific class {@link TraceLevel}
085        // that has constants for the SPL log levels.
086        for (String parameterName : context.getParameterNames()) {
087            for (String value : context.getParameterValues(parameterName)) {
088                trace.log(TraceLevel.INFO, "Parameter {0} has value {1}", new Object[] {parameterName, value});
089            }
090        }
091        
092        // Example of logging a warning using a message from
093        // the resource bundle with key ex01.
094        
095        log.warning("ex01");
096        
097        // Example of logging an exception using a message from
098        // the resource bundle with key ex02. The level uses
099        // the Java Operator API specific class {@link LogLevel}
100        // that has constants for the SPL log levels.
101        try {
102            setup();
103        } catch (Exception e) {
104            log.log(LogLevel.ERROR, "ex02", e);
105            throw e;
106        }
107    }
108    
109    /**
110     * Dummy method to demonstrate logging an exception in initialize.
111     * @throws Exception
112     */
113    private void setup() throws Exception {
114    }
115        
116    /**
117     * Example use of a standard {@code Logger} methods to
118     * trace method entry and exit. 
119     */
120    @Override
121    public void shutdown() throws Exception
122    {
123        trace.entering(CLASS_NAME, "shutdown");
124        super.shutdown();
125        
126        // Perform operator specific shutdown
127        
128        trace.entering(CLASS_NAME, "shutdown");
129    }
130}
